message_1:
A math student has collected data on the number of hours studied and the corresponding score received on an exam for 10 students. Using regression analysis, the student wants to find the equation of the line of best fit for the data. The following data was collected:

Hours Studied (x)    Score (y)
3                                   70
5                                   62
7                                   75
9                                   82
10                                 93
15                                 88
18                                97
20                                94
21                                98
25                                92

What is the equation of the line of best fit for this data?
message_2:
To find the equation of the line of best fit, we will use the least squares method. First, we need to find the mean of the x values (hours studied) and the mean of the y values (scores).

Mean of x values (x̄) = (3 + 5 + 7 + 9 + 10 + 15 + 18 + 20 + 21 + 25) / 10 = 133 / 10 = 13.3
Mean of y values (ȳ) = (70 + 62 + 75 + 82 + 93 + 88 + 97 + 94 + 98 + 92) / 10 = 851 / 10 = 85.1

Next, we need to find the slope (m) of the line of best fit using the formula:

m = Σ[(x - x̄)(y - ȳ)] / Σ(x - x̄)^2

Calculating the numerator and denominator:

Σ[(x - x̄)(y - ȳ)] = (3-13.3)(70-85.1) + (5-13.3)(62-85.1) + ... + (25-13.3)(92-85.1) = 506.9

Σ(x - x̄)^2 = (3-13.3)^2 + (5-13.3)^2 + ... + (25-13.3)^2 = 716.1

Now, we can find the slope:

m = 506.9 / 716.1 ≈ 0.708

Finally, we need to find the y-intercept (b) using the formula:

b = ȳ - m * x̄

b = 85.1 - 0.708 * 13.3 ≈ 75.4

So, the equation of the line of best fit is:

y = 0.708x + 75.4
